title: Golding on status of LSU assistants: Not up to me
content: Ole Miss coach Pete Golding says it's up to LSU to determine how many of Lane Kiffin's assistants can continue to coach their former team as the Rebels prepare for Miami.

title: Irish's Shrewsberry reprimanded for chasing ref
content: The ACC has issued a public reprimand of Micah Shrewsberry following an incident between the Notre Dame coach and an official at the end of the Fighting Irish's loss at California.

title: Amid boos, Baylor's Nnaji debuts in loss at TCU
content: James Nnaji, the 7-foot center and 2023 NBA draft pick whose signing drew criticism from coaches across college basketball last month, debuted Saturday, scoring five points with four fouls in Baylor's 69-63 loss to TCU in the Big 12 opener for both teams.

title: Top passer Mestemaker commits to Oklahoma St.
content: QB Drew Mestemaker, who leads the country in passing yards this year, told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Saturday that he has committed to Oklahoma State and his former coach, Eric Morris.

title: Giants TE Johnson watches Knicks but out finale
content: Giants tight end Theo Johnson, who attended a Knicks game Friday night despite not practicing all week with a reported illness, will not play in Sunday's season finale.

title: Sources: Japan's Okamoto, Jays reach $60M deal
content: The Blue Jays and Japanese third baseman Kazuma Okamoto are in agreement on a free agent contract, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Clemson bringing back Morris as OC
content: Former Clemson offensive coordinator Chad Morris is nearing a deal to return to the Tigers in the same role, sources confirmed to ESPN on Saturday.

title: Unbeaten Huskers to fans: Quit storming court
content: Rienk Mast hit the tiebreaking 3-pointer with 1:51 left and finished with 19 points to lead No. 13 Nebraska to a 58-56 victory over No. 9 Michigan State before asking Cornhuskers fans to stop storming the court.

title: US strikes Venezuela: MEA issues advisory for Indians; urges to avoid non-essential travel
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly advised its citizens to avoid non-essential travel to Venezuela following multiple strikes by the United States. "All Indians who are in Venezuela for any reason are advised to exercise extreme caution, restrict their movements, and remain in contact with Embassy of India in Caracas," the ministry's advisory read.

title: Mustafizur row: 'No fault of Shah Rukh' - 1983 WC hero backs KKR co-owner
content: The former World Cup winner said Shah Rukh Khan should not be linked to the matter and pointed out that team selection is handled by the franchise‚Äôs cricket management.

title: ‚ÄòSir would go after me‚Äô: Himachal Pradesh college student dies after 'sexual harassment'
content: A Himachal Pradesh college professor and three students face charges of sexual harassment and ragging following the death of a 19-year-old student. The victim had accused them of mistreatment, which her father claims led to her depression and eventual death. Police are investigating the cause of death and verifying all allegations.

title: Amazon‚Äôs exception for Indians: H-1B delay relief for employees; reverses Andy Jassy‚Äôs 2025 move
content: Amazon is giving its India-based employees a temporary remote work pass until early March due to visa processing snags.  But, there are strict rules: no coding, no big strategy talks, and definitely no chatting with customers. This shows how big tech companies are really feeling the pinch from H-1B visa backlogs, messing with their work and how much gets done.

title: Venezuela crisis: Trump says US oil firms will enter country; assures supply to China
content: US President Trump announced US oil companies will invest billions to repair Venezuela's infrastructure and restart production following the capture of President Maduro. Despite existing sanctions, Trump stated major US energy firms will tap vast crude reserves, aiming to enrich Venezuela and ensure its independence and safety.

title: A‚Äôja Wilson vs Sophie Cunningham net worth 2025: WNBA salary and endorsements
content: WNBA stars A'ja Wilson and Sophie Cunningham are making significant strides both on and off the court. Wilson, a Las Vegas Aces powerhouse, boasts a $4 million net worth with lucrative endorsements and a $200k annual salary. Meanwhile, Indiana Fever's Cunningham, with a $2 million net worth, earns $100k annually from her contract and brand deals.

title: DeepSeek drops training bomb: Shares path to cheaper AI models ‚Äî here's why next model matters
content: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek unveiled a groundbreaking training method, "Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections," potentially slashing AI development costs. This innovation challenges the notion that advanced AI necessitates massive computing power, following their previous success with the R1 model. The breakthrough intensifies industry debates on scaling AI, with expectations high for DeepSeek's next model release.

title: Mike Evans injury update: Is Buccaneers WR playing this week?
content: Star wide receiver Mike Evans is expected to play in the crucial Week 18 game for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, with his playoff hopes on the line. Despite a missed practice, the team confirmed it was a strategic rest day for the veteran, not an injury concern.

title: Hidden side effects of drinking black coffee daily
content: Black coffee, often seen as a healthy choice, can quietly impact your body. Regular consumption without awareness can lead to digestive issues, disrupted sleep, increased anxiety, and dehydration. It may also affect mineral absorption and cause heart sensations. Paying attention to your body's signals is key to enjoying coffee without adverse effects.

title: 'Venezuelan forces were waiting': Trump details how US carried out Caracas strikes; gives 'larger attack' warning
content: President Trump declared Venezuelan forces were "completely overwhelmed" during a recent US operation, with many ships present. He stated the US is prepared for a larger follow-up if necessary. Trump also claimed success in intercepting 97% of sea-borne drugs and announced the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro overnight, highlighting the mission's swiftness and effectiveness.

title: Chinese billionaire who wants 20 US-born children has 'marriage plans with' Elon Musk
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo, founder of a major mobile gaming firm, is reportedly aiming to father dozens of children via American surrogates to inherit his vast fortune.  He allegedly fantasizes about his offspring marrying Elon Musk's children.  While his company admits to surrogacy, they deny claims of over 100 children, stating only 12 were born in the US.

title: 'MGNREGA bachao': Congress to challenge G RAM G in court; 45-day nationwide protest
content: Congress has launched a 45-day nationwide protest, the 'MGNREGA bachao sangram,' starting January 8, demanding the restoration of the job guarantee scheme. The party plans to challenge the new VB-GRAMG law in court, alleging it violates constitutional provisions by shifting financial burdens to states and undermining panchayat autonomy.  This agitation aims to force the government to reinstate the scheme.

title: 'Dragged out of their bedroom': New details on how US captured Maduro, his wife - where are they now
content: Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, were captured in a swift US military raid on their Caracas residence. Elite Delta Force and FBI agents conducted the operation, seizing the couple without resistance. President Trump confirmed their US custody, with charges of narco-terrorism expected in New York.

title: Joel Embiid injury update: Latest status vs Knicks for Jan 3
content: Joel Embiid is probable for the Philadelphia 76ers' January 3, 2026, matchup against the New York Knicks, with his right ankle sprain no longer on the injury report. This indicates improved health as the Sixers aim to build on recent wins. Embiid's availability offers a chance for both him and the team to gauge their standing entering the season's core.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet became the 49ers‚Äô $8.4B empire
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: Magic Johnson & Cookie Johnson 2025 net worth: Earnings and endorsements
content: NBA legend Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, boast a combined net worth of $1.6 billion. Magic's fortune stems from his basketball career and a vast business empire, including stakes in the Los Angeles Dodgers. Cookie has carved her own path as a successful author and entrepreneur, contributing significantly to their wealth and advocating for AIDS awareness.

title: Brittany Mahomes shares New Year glimpse as Patrick Mahomes continues rehab
content: Patrick Mahomes is entering 2026 focused entirely on rehab after suffering ACL and LCL tears late in the season. A New Year post from Brittany Mahomes confirmed he is still on crutches, reinforcing the long road ahead. Andy Reid stressed patience, noting Mahomes remains around the team while prioritizing recovery over travel or timelines.

title: 'Never seen anything like it': Trump describes Maduro's capture
content: US President Donald Trump described the capture of Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro as a "television show" following a "large scale" strike. The US announced the successful operation, stating Maduro and his wife were captured and flown out of the country. The strike involved extensive planning and followed a military buildup in the region.

title: 76ers vs Knicks: Full injury report, who‚Äôs out and where to watch (Jan 3)
content: Philadelphia 76ers face the New York Knicks on January 3, 2026, at Madison Square Garden. Both teams are battling injuries, with key players like Joel Embiid and Josh Hart questionable. Tyrese Maxey's scoring prowess will be crucial for the Sixers, while the Knicks aim to leverage their strong home record.

title: Power check 2026: Top politicians in focus this year
content: The year 2026 is set to be a pivotal electoral year, featuring crucial assembly elections in West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry. These contests will significantly shape the careers of key leaders and test the national ambitions of major parties, influencing the landscape leading up to the 2029 Lok Sabha elections.

title: Indian football: Crisis-hit ISL's restart in sight; AIFF to announce dates next week
content: In a statement, the AIFF said the Emergency Committee met on January 3 to consider and acknowledge the report submitted by the AIFF-ISL Coordination Committee. The Coordination Committee was set up on December 20, 2025, following discussions during the AIFF Executive Committee meeting and the subsequent Annual General Meeting.

title: US attacks Venezuela: How Trump gave 'green light' to capture Maduro ‚Äì all about CIA‚Äôs covert op
content: US President Donald Trump reportedly approved the capture of Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro, with the operation reportedly carried out by Delta Force. The CIA tracked Maduro's location after being authorized for covert operations, and he is expected to face trial in the United States. This action follows months of US pressure on Maduro's government.

title: New Zealand an underrated study-abroad pick for Indian students in 2026: Expert explains why
content: New Zealand is emerging as a strong contender for Indian students seeking overseas education in 2026, offering a predictable and structured pathway. With its top-ranked universities, excellent work-life balance, and clear post-study work rights, it appeals to students prioritizing manageability and consistent outcomes over sheer scale. Popular courses include IT, environmental sciences, and business.

title: ‚ÄòWe want our oil back‚Äô: Trump's old video resurfaces as US strikes Venezuela
content: US airstrikes hit Venezuela, including Caracas, leading to a national emergency. President Trump claimed Maduro's capture, citing oil interests and drug trafficking. An old video resurfaced showing Trump's focus on Venezuela's oil. The US pursued a maximum pressure campaign, offering a bounty on Maduro and labeling gangs as terrorists, ultimately seizing tankers and building military presence.

title: T20 WC: Will Bangladesh be allowed to play in India? BCCI breaks silence
content: The BCCI has asked Kolkata Knight Riders to release Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman from IPL 2026, a decision limited only to the tournament. Indian cricket board chief Mithun Manhas confirmed no decision has been taken yet on Bangladesh‚Äôs matches in the 2026 T20 World Cup in India. The move follows criticism and concerns linked to recent developments in Bangladesh.

title: US captures Maduro: Where is Nobel winner Machado; why she gains most from Trump's move
content: While Machado has not reacted publicly to Trump‚Äôs announcement, the developments place her at the centre of a rapidly shifting political moment in Venezuela. She has previously voiced strong support for Trump‚Äôs aggressive approach toward the Maduro regime and has openly backed external pressure, including military intervention, to end what she describes as communist rule in the country.

title: Pant retains place, Shami ignored: India announce team for NZ ODIs; see full squad
content: Shreyas Iyer has been included in the squad and named vice-captain. However, his availability is "subject to fitness clearance from BCCI COE," the board said in a release.

title: Serial killer who called himself ‚Äòking‚Äô: Shadows of ‚Äòcannibal‚Äô Raja Kolander
content: Justice has finally arrived for Manoj Kumar Singh and Ravi Srivastava, who vanished in 2000. Their case, unsolved for 25 years, found closure with the discovery of a brown coat. This garment, identified as belonging to Manoj Kumar Singh, was found in Raja Kolander's home. Kolander and an accomplice were convicted for their abduction and murder.

title: 'Weighing all options': BCCI keeps Bangladesh tour on hold; BCB calls for emergency meeting
content: It may be recalled that the BCCI had cancelled its previous tour of Bangladesh this year following rising diplomatic tension between the two nations. BCCI representatives also declined to travel to Dhaka for Asian Cricket Council (ACC) meetings.

title: 'Don't know what's coming next': Fear and hope collide as Venezuela wakes after US strikes
content: Caracas awoke to eerie quiet and smoke Saturday after US commandos reportedly captured President Nicolas Maduro and his wife in overnight strikes. Explosions rocked the capital, with damage reported at a port and near an air base. Residents, glued to phones, expressed uncertainty about the future, while some opposition supporters felt cautious joy.

title: Michael Jordan & Yvette Prieto net worth 2025: Career earnings and endorsements
content: Michael Jordan and Yvette Prieto boast a combined net worth exceeding $3.8 billion as of 2025. Jordan's wealth stems from his NBA career, lucrative endorsements, and the $3 billion sale of his Charlotte Hornets shares. Prieto, a former model and actress, has contributed significantly, with her own estimated net worth and a substantial prenup agreement.

title: US strikes Venezuela: What it means for oil supply and prices? Impact on India
content: Global oil markets have to be watching closely after US strikes on Venezuela. However, early signs indicate minimal disruption. Venezuela's oil exports were already limited by US sanctions. India's dependence on Venezuelan oil is low, with minimal trade and some investment. The US plans significant involvement in Venezuela's oil industry.

title: 'Criminal military aggression': Venezuela govt after US attack‚Äîwhat we know
content: Venezuela accuses the US of attacking civilian and military sites, prompting President Maduro to declare a state of emergency and call for mass mobilization. US officials confirmed President Trump ordered strikes on Venezuelan military facilities, escalating a campaign against the Maduro government amid a regional military buildup and recent seizures of oil tankers.

title: Scottie Pippen net worth 2025-26: Hall of Famer‚Äôs earnings, career and more
content: Scottie Pippen, a legendary NBA player, has a net worth of $20 million by 2025, according to Celebrity Net Worth. His career salary reached $109 million. Pippen's earnings from contracts and endorsements significantly boosted his wealth. He is considered one of the most underpaid players in NBA history. His iconic Nike partnership and endorsements with major brands expanded his financial empire.

title: FIIs extend selling streak in early sessions of 2026; analysts expect turnaround later
content: Foreign institutional investors continued their selling streak into early 2026, offloading Indian equities worth Rs 7,608 crore in the first two sessions after a record Rs 1.66 lakh crore outflow in 2025. High valuations and a global shift to AI trades were cited as key drivers for the sustained exit, which also weakened the rupee.

title: IND vs NZ: Shreyas Iyer returns to ODI squad ‚Äî but there is a catch
content: Shreyas Iyer has returned to India‚Äôs ODI squad for the New Zealand series and has been named vice-captain, but his selection depends on final fitness clearance from the BCCI‚Äôs Centre of Excellence. Recovering from an abdominal injury, Iyer could make his comeback if cleared, as the team management prioritises fitness ahead of major tournaments.

title: US strikes Venezuela: Maduro met Chinese envoy hours before being captured ‚Äî watch
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro met with a Chinese government representative in Caracas, hours before U.S. President Donald Trump falsely claimed Maduro had been captured following American military strikes. U.S. officials cited by CBS News alleged Delta Force operators took Maduro into custody, a claim Venezuela's Vice President denied, demanding proof of life.

title: What happens if the Moon disappears
content: Earth's oceans would experience significantly smaller tides without the Moon. Marine life dependent on tidal motion would face drastic changes. Nocturnal predators and prey behavior would shift dramatically. Earth's axial tilt would become unstable, leading to extreme seasonal variations over long periods. Human activities, from coastal industries to agriculture, would be profoundly impacted.

title: 'Will not yield to enemy': Khamenei responds to Trump threat; warns 'rioters must be put in place'
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei stated Iran will not yield to the enemy, responding to US President Donald Trump's offer of aid to protesters. Khamenei acknowledged economic grievances driving demonstrations but warned against "rioters," vowing to "bring the enemy to its knees." Protests over rising prices have turned violent, with at least eight reported deaths.

title: Equity 2026: Capex revival likely to gain momentum; defence, infrastructure set to benefit
content: India's capital expenditure is showing promising signs of recovery, with defence, capital goods, and manufacturing sectors poised for significant growth over the next few years. Improved economic conditions and policy support are driving this revival. Foreign investors may also return in 2026 as corporate earnings are projected to re-accelerate, offering attractive investment opportunities.

title: Live Updates: Maria Machado Doesn't Have "Support Or Respect" To Run Venezuela: Trump
content: Multiple explosions heard in Venezuela LIVE Updates: The United States on Sunday confirmed that it conducted strikes inside Venezuela moments after several explosions were heard in the capital Caracas and other parts of the country.

title: Woman Kills Daughter-In-Law Over Dead Son's Government Job: Cops
content: A 60-year-old woman from Maharashtra's Thane district has been arrested for allegedly killing her daughter-in-law over a dispute involving a railway job and gratuity funds, police said on Saturday.

title: Weather Body Issues Yellow Alert As Dense Smog Envelops Delhi
content: Dense smog and fog enveloped large parts of the national Capital on Saturday morning, significantly reducing visibility and affecting daily life across the city.

title: 65% Of Delhi's Air Pollution In 2025 Came From Nearby Areas: Study
content: As much as 65 per cent of Delhi's air pollution in 2025 originated from outside the city, mainly from other NCR districts, while local sources accounted for the remaining 35 per cent, a study said.

title: "US To Run Venezuela For Now": Trump's Announcement After Maduro's Capture
content: US President Donald Trump made a stunning claim that the US "will run" Venezuela until a "proper and judicious" transition was in effect.

title: Mock House, CIA Source, Special Forces: The US Operation To Capture Maduro
content: At 4:21 on Saturday morning, U.S. President Donald Trump sent a message on his Truth Social platform: the United States had carried out a daring mission to capture Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife.

title: Nicolas Maduro And Wife Dragged From Bedroom At Military Base By US Forces: Report
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and First Lady Cilia Flores were seized during a surprise nighttime raid by US forces after being pulled from their bedroom.

title: Himachal Professor Suspended Over Sexual Assault Charge After Student Dies
content: Himachal Pradesh Government on Saturday suspended an assistant professor of the Government College, Dharamshala, in connection with the alleged sexual harassment and ragging of a 19-year-old Dalit girl, who died during treatment last week.

title: Girl, 13, Gang-Raped By 3 Minors In Karnataka's Hubballi
content: A girl, barely 13 years old, has allegedly been gang-raped by three boys between the ages of 14 to 15 in Karnataka's Hubballi, police said on Saturday.

title: Trump Says US Oil Firms To Head Into Venezuela
content: President Donald Trump said Saturday he would allow American oil companies to head into Venezuela to tap its massive crude reserves after a US military operation that seized the country's leader Nicolas Maduro.

title: Rs 3.65 Crore Assets Of Bengal Minister Attached In Teacher Recruitment Scam
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED), Kolkata Zonal Office, has provisionally attached immovable properties worth Rs 3.65 crore belonging to West Bengal MLA and Minister Chandranath Sinha.

title: Machado "Very Nice Woman, But Doesn't Have Respect" To Run Venezuela: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday brushed aside Nobel Peace Prize-winning opposition leader Maria Corina Machado as a potential interim leader of Venezuela, as he said Washington was working with deposed Nicolas Maduro's vice president.

title: Top Court Verdict On Bail Plea Of Umar Khalid In Delhi Riots Case On Monday
content: The Supreme Court will deliver its verdict on the bail pleas of activists Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and others accused in the 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case on January 5.

title: India Asks Citizens To Avoid Going To Venezuela Hours After US Captures Maduro
content: India on Saturday night advised its nationals to avoid all non-essential travel to Venezuela in view of the situation arising out of the capture of the oil-rich country's president by the US.

title: "Prepared To Take Power": Venezuelan Opposition Leader After Maduro's Capture
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said on Saturday that the "hour of freedom" had arrived for her country after President Nicolas Maduro was captured by the US forces.

title: 'No American killed In Maduro Op, It Was Like Watching A TV Show': Trump
content: Praising his troops again for successfully capturing Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, US President Donald Trump has said no American lives were lost during the operation.

title: RSS Flags 'Love Jihad', Pushes For Women's Empowerment At Bhopal Meet
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) on Sunday projected women's empowerment and social cohesion as key pillars of its ideological and organisational strategy.

title: Dozens Charged For Violating VPN Ban In Jammu And Kashmir
content: Dozens of people have been charged in Jammu and Kashmir for using virtual private networks (VPN) after police intensified a major crackdown against the unauthorised use of VPN services.

title: BJP Alleges Rs 100 Crore Flood Relief Scam In Bengal, Cites CAG Report
content: The Bengal BJP on Friday launched a sharp attack on the Trinamool Congress, citing a 700-page report by the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) regarding an alleged Rs 100 crore scam in the distribution of relief funds for the 2017 Malda district.

title: What China Said After US Forces Captured Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro
content: China said on Saturday it firmly opposes US military strikes on Venezuela and the capture of the country's leader Nicolas Maduro, calling it a violation of international law.

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: Testing grit and will power with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: Big 12: 11 potential (and probable) tournament teams
content: the big 12 has a realistic shot to regain its crown in 2025-26 . two of the projected no. 1 seeds have raced to their lofty perch with a combined 26-0 record . AJ Dybantsa is predictedably dangerous, leaving preseason no.1 Houston as an under the radar national title contender .

title: World Series champion Orioles? Skubal blockbuster?
content: we asked our experts to give their boldest predictions for what the new year will bring . a look into the crystal ball for the topics that will have us all talking in 2026 . the Baltimore Orioles finished last in the AL East in 2025, but their 75 wins were the most .

content: the 2025-26 bowl season has reached its end, but college football experts have highlighted the best performances from the past month . we've picked MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . QB Robby Ashford stewarded one of the nation's most surprising success stories this fall .

title: Olympic hockey roster grades for U.S., Canada, Finland, Sweden, plus snubs and surprises
content: the 2026 winter Olympic men's hockey tournament begins febr. 12 in Milan, Italy . the tournament promises to have some great games, battles for medals and of course the potential for another round in the USA vs. Canada rivalry . before the teams hit the ice, they needed to officially lock in their rosters .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: US special forces capture Venezuela's President Maduro
content: president and his wife were asleep at their home in a military fortress in caracas . the couple was dragged out of their beds and flown out on choppers by an elite Delta Force, CIA agents, and FBI agents . they were placed on the warship Iwo Jima anchored off the country‚Äôs coast .

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: ‚ÄòSaddam Hussein, Laden ‚Ä¶ Maduro': Venezuelan president captured by US ‚Äî what happens next
content: Look, this is an utterly startling development. I only think of comparables to the operation against Osama bin Laden‚Ä¶ and the capture of Saddam Hussein back almost over 20 years ago now. This is certainly the most strident foreign military intervention of President Trump‚Äôs‚Ä¶ presidency so far At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: Bengal polls: Will increase tea garden workers‚Äô daily wages to ‚Çπ300¬†after we form govt., says TMC MP Abhishek¬†Banerjee
content: TMC MP said he will raise the issue of creches and PHCs in Kolkata in front of senior party leaders and CM Mamata Banerjee

title: Tamil Nadu government‚Äôs new pension scheme broadly follows the guidelines of Old Pension Scheme
content: Asked when the proposed scheme will come into force, a senior official says legal formalities, including amendment to the pension rules, will have to be carried out first

title: Development a key focus, says Thrikkakara municipal chief
content: The idea is to focus on ten key goals and ensure they are met. These include improvements in waste management, ensuring a reliable and adequate water supply, stray dog control, and fostering sustainable urban development, among others, says Rashid Ullamppilly

title: NCC cadets assisted authorities during Operation Sindoor: Lt. Gen. Virendra Vats
content: During the India-Pak. conflict, 75,000 cadets helped the administration, provided medical assistance and arranged voluntary blood donation, says NCC chief

title: Call to preserve the mother tongue for future generations
content: On the second day of the book festival, Dalit litterateur Koyi Koteswara Rao appeals to the citizens to oppose the ideology of ‚ÄòManusmriti‚Äô

title: President Droupadi Murmu‚Äôs life teaches us how perseverance leads to success, says Odisha Governor
content: Despite innumerable challenges, she weathered all the challenges and worked tirelessly for the public good, says Haribabu

title: Centre pushes States to speed up farm scheme spending, warns of fund delays
content: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said States must ensure funds earmarked for various schemes are spent before March to avoid administrative bottlenecks that delay the effective implementation of programmes

title: Promote khadi, encourage indigenous artisans, says Vijayawada MP
content: It is our responsibility to pass on khadi products as a heritage to the future generations, says Kesineni Sivanath

title: Bihar launches healthcare facilities for elderly at doorsteps
content: The facilities include nursing assistance, pathology tests, blood pressure check, ECG test, physiotherapy and all types of medical assistance in emergency situations.

title: Left parties condemn U.S. ‚Äúaggression‚Äù in Venezuela
content: The CPI, CPI(M) and the All India Forward Bloc all condemned the U.S. strikes on the Latin American country and the capture of President Nicol√°s Maduro

title: Hopeful that DMK will conclude seat-sharing talks at the earliest: Girish Chodankar
content: He says the Congress has received close to 5,000 applications from aspiring candidates and the conclusion of the seat-sharing negotiations is essential as the party can then concentrate on choosing the candidates and campaigning

title: Barber held for playing 'anti-national' songs at his shop in Palghar district
content: According to locals who complained to the police, he allegedly played provocative content regularly, ignoring previous warnings, an official said

title: Those who lost homes in Kogilu to hold a rally today; BJP to protest on Monday
content: GBA and Rajiv Gandhi Housing Corporation Ltd. have finalised the list of those eligible for alternative housing in Kogilu Layout. However, verification by the Ashraya Committee is awaited

title: DVAC seizes unaccounted cash, gold coins, new silk sarees at DRDA Project Director‚Äôs office in Ranipet
content: Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) officials said that residents have complained of irregularities including extra charge and commission for sanctioning works in rural areas

title: Congress announces panels for poll-bound States; Priyanka to head screening committee for Assam election
content: While Ms. Vadra will head the screening committee for Assam, other members of the panel include Lok Sabha MP Saptagiri Ulaka and Rajya Sabha MP Imran Masood

title: National Education Policy will bring country's new generation out of Macaulay mentality: Pradhan
content: The NEP, announced on July 29, 2020, proposes various reforms in school education as well as higher and technical education

title: CM accuses KCR of Kaleshwaram type exploitation in PRLIS too
content: Revanth Reddy vows to draw water from Jurala for the project in case clearances are not given to PRLIS with Srisailam as source

title: Andaman & Nicobar Islands will be a major contributor to India‚Äôs treasury in 10 years: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister inaugurates and lays foundation stones for various projects worth ‚Çπ373 crore in the archipelago. He also chairs a Parliamentary Consultative Committee meeting focused on issues of national security, disaster management, cyber security and regional infrastructure.

title: Three-year jail term for Kerala MLA Antony Raju in tampering with evidence case
content: Raju, a leader of the Janadhipathya Kerala Congress, an LDF ally, will be disqualified as an MLA on account of his conviction in the case; Although the court sentenced him to three years in jail, he was granted bail and one month‚Äôs time to appeal against the verdict

title: West Bengal SIR: Cases of ‚Äòlogical discrepancies‚Äô in progeny mapping come down to 95 lakh
content: The Election Commission of India officials had earlier flagged 1.67 crore cases of suspicious progeny mapping with the 2002 electoral roll

title: Security heightened along Bangladesh border in Tripura
content: The vigil along the border was increased after reports of the movement of members of two Bangladesh-based armed groups

title: Army signs deal to procure long-range rocket launchers Suryastra
content: It has signed a ‚Çπ293 crore contract with NIBE Limited, backed by Israeli technology, for an advanced long-range rocket launcher system, in collaboration with Israel, with strike capabilities of 150 km and 300 km

title: Too little, too late: Congress on Centre‚Äôs 90-day threshold for gig workers‚Äô social security
content: The Opposition argued that the Centre‚Äôs vision for the unorganised sector falls short of the provisions made out by Congress governments in Telangana, Rajasthan, and Karnataka to support gig workers

title: Telugu is a way of life, says Assembly Speaker
content: Addressing the third World Telugu Conference near Amaravati, Ayyanna Patrudu stresses the need to preserve cultural traditions and promote mother-tongue education at the primary level

title: Trinamool MP Mausam Noor returns to the Congress
content: ‚ÄòWest Bengal wants change,‚Äô the two-time Lok Sabha MP says after joining the Congress, in whose leadership she says she has complete faith

title: Odisha Police begin probe into alleged violation of power by aide of Naveen Patnaik
content: DSP Santosh Kumar Gauda, assigned to investigate allegations against a former IAS officer, seeks evidence from petitioner Surendra Panigrahi

title: Himachal government initiates probe into Dharamshala college girl‚Äôs death; assistant professor suspended
content: The State has constituted a committee, which will examine the charges of sexual assault, caste-based abuse, etc., and submit a report within three days

title: The psychology behind fraud: Why people fall prey despite knowing better
content: Representative AI image Red flags may still be visible, but the brain temporarily ignores them because emotional safety feels more urgent than accuracy. This is why scams often target people during vulnerable moments ‚Äî late at night, after a loss, or during financial uncertainty. Emotional stress such as fear of loss, financial pressure, or loneliness activates the limbic system, particularly the amygdala, which prioritizes emotional survival responses over careful analysis.

title: Stray dog attack exposes safety lapses at Kochi taluk hospital
content: The hospital has been without a compound wall for years after the previous one was demolished for proposed renovation works funded by the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board

title: Kerala SIR: EC yet to resolve ‚ÄòPlace of Birth‚Äô issue in Form 6A, allege political parties
content: This field in the application is restricted to Indian States, making it impossible for Indian citizens born abroad to accurately complete the process, parties point out

title: Infam celebrates 25th anniversary with a slew of programmes
content: Inaugurated a public meeting, Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan raises concerns of the farming community

title: CITU to fight against move to privatise education, health and job sectors
content: At its 18th All-India Conference, it passes resolutions seeking, among others, steps to prevent industrial accidents, universal pension of not less than ‚Çπ5,000 per month to the aged population,  and restoration of Old Pension Scheme

title: Supreme Court to pronounce verdict in bail pleas of Umar Khalid, others in Delhi riots case on January 5
content: The appellants are accused of being the ‚Äòmasterminds‚Äô behind the riots, which left 53 people dead and over 700 injured; violence had erupted during protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act and the National Register of Citizens

title: TTD to leverage VR, AR to highlight local, affiliated temples
content: Special officers should be appointed to provide better facilities to the devotees at the TTD local and affiliated temples, says Executive Officer

title: Stalemate over demolition of Chander Kunj Army Towers continues to New Year
content: Of the 208 apartment owners, all except Ciby George, a retired Army Colonel and resident of apartment number 101 in Tower C, have vacated

title: Spirituality makes people become good citizens in society: Vice-President

content: The attempt is to create an impression that an inquiry has been conducted, without registering a case, only to ensure that the CPI(M)‚Äôs role does not come to light, says Joseph Tajet

title: CPI(M) strongly condemns U.S. invasion of Venezuela
content: U.S.  attack on Venezuela is a blatant imperialist invasion on a country that resisted the imperialistic designs and American domination over the years, says CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby
